data.text: More deadly and deadliest are the usual forms. You can also use most deadly .
常用more deadly和deadliest，亦可用most deadly。

data.enText: causing or likely to cause death

data.chText: 眼镜蛇是世界上毒性最剧烈的蛇类之一。
data.enText: The cobra is one of the world's deadliest snakes.

data.chText: 恐怖分子故意要同平民百姓做死亡游戏。
data.enText: The terrorists have chosen to play a deadly game with the civilian population.

data.chText: 他们是不共戴天的仇敌。
data.enText: They are deadly enemies (= are full of hatred for each other) .

data.chText: 非常有效的；无法防御的
data.enText: extremely effective, so that no defence is possible
His aim is deadly (= so accurate that he can kill easily) .

data.chText: 这是杀手前锋本赛季的第11个进球。
data.enText: It was the deadly striker's 11th goal of the season.

data.chText: 那场讲座简直无聊透了。
极其严肃认真 / 乏味
死一般地苍白；冷得要死

ex.chText: 艾滋病是一种致命的疾病。

ex.enText: The nuclear bomb is one type of deadly weapons.

synonyms.bx: 指事物（如疾病、武器等）致命的。

ex.chText: 他设计的程序中有个致命的缺陷。
ex.enText: There was a fatal flaw in his program.

ex.chText: 那位年轻的候选人在大选中遭受了灾难性的打击。
ex.enText: That young candidate suffered a fatal blow in the election.

synonyms.bx: 强调死亡的不可避免性，多用于指疾病；还可指造成失败或毁灭性后果的。

ex.chText: 他在最后一次战斗中受到了致命的重伤。
ex.enText: He received a mortal wound in the final battle.
Our hotel is in mortal danger.

synonyms.bx: 主要指伤口等致命的，或情况非常危急的。

tr: (of a disease) having a rapid course and violent effect
causing or capable of causing death
of an instrument of certain death
involving loss of divine grace or spiritual death

value.def: If something is deadly, it is likely or able to cause someone's death, or has already caused someone's death.

example.ex: He was acquitted on charges of assault with a deadly weapon.
example.tran: 他被判用致命武器袭击他人的罪名不成立。
目前正在威胁海豚生命的致命疾病

example.ex: Passive smoking can be deadly too...
example.tran: 被动吸烟也可能会致命。

example.ex: The authorities are looking into last week's deadly gas explosions.
example.tran: 当局正在调查上周发生的恶性瓦斯爆炸事件。

value.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as deadly, you mean that they will do or say anything to get what they want, without caring about other people.

example.ex: His mother's voice was one he knew; ice cold and deadly...
example.tran: 母亲的声音是他很熟悉的：冰冷、无情。

example.ex: The Duchess levelled a deadly look at Nikko.
example.tran: 女公爵目光冷峻地盯着尼科。

value.tran: 为达目的不择手段的;阴险毒辣的;冷酷无情的

value.def: If you describe someone or something as deadly, you mean that you think they are very dull and boring.

example.tran: 她觉得这些聚会无聊极了。

value.tran: 非常乏味的;极其无聊的

value.def: You can use deadly to emphasize that something has a particular quality, especially an unpleasant or undesirable quality.

example.ex: Broadcast news was accurate and reliable but deadly dull...
example.tran: 新闻广播准确可靠但却非常枯燥。

example.ex: The north wind was bitter and deadly cold...
The United States had been deadly serious in its threat of military action.
example.tran: 美国威胁说要采取军事行动绝对是认真的。

value.tran: (尤用于强调令人不快或不受欢迎的特质) 极其，非常

value.def: A deadly situation has unpleasant or dangerous consequences.

example.ex: ...the deadly combination of low expectations and low achievement.
example.tran: 糟糕的是期望值低，收获也低

example.ex: It is here that most students fall into a subtle and deadly trap.
example.tran: 正是在这一点上大多数学生落入了一个不易察觉但却非常危险的陷阱。

value.def: Deadly enemies or rivals fight or compete with each other in a very aggressive way.

example.ex: That would make the competition between rival suppliers even deadlier.
example.tran: 那将使得对立供应商之间的竞争更加你死我活。

value.tran: (敌人或对手)殊死的，不共戴天的

value.def: In sport, deadly players and actions are extremely skilful and successful.

example.ex: ...the fastest and deadliest bowlers in world cricket today.
example.tran: 当今世界板球界速度最快、最具杀伤力的投手

value.tran: (运动员或其动作）极富技巧性的，极难防御的

trans: 毒药；剧毒；致命毒药；增加获得致命毒；致命药膏
死罪；不可饶恕的罪行；致死之罪；怨灵效应；宗罪
七原罪；七宗罪；七大罪；七宗死罪；七大原罪
